android.gadget
Class GadgetHost

java.lang.Object
  android.gadget.GadgetHost

public class GadgetHost
extends Object

GadgetHost provides the interaction with the Gadget Service for apps, like the home screen, that want to embed gadgets in their UI.

Constructor Summary
GadgetHost(Context context, int hostId)

Constructor Detail

GadgetHost

public GadgetHost(Context context,
                  int hostId)
Method Detail

startListening

public void startListening()
Start receiving onGadgetChanged calls for your gadgets. Call this when your activity becomes visible, i.e. from onStart() in your Activity.

stopListening

public void stopListening()
Stop receiving onGadgetChanged calls for your gadgets. Call this when your activity is no longer visible, i.e. from onStop() in your Activity.

gadgetRemoved

public void gadgetRemoved(int gadgetId)
Stop listening to changes for this gadget.

clearGadgets

public void clearGadgets()
Remove all records about gadget instances from the gadget manager. Call this when initializing your database, as it might be because of a data wipe.

createView

public final GadgetHostView createView(Context context,
                                       int gadgetId,
                                       GadgetInfo gadget)

onCreateView

protected GadgetHostView onCreateView(Context context,
                                      int gadgetId,
                                      GadgetInfo gadget)
Called to create the GadgetHostView. Override to return a custom subclass if you need it.
